item.title: Allen & Heath AB168
item.description: Getting Started Guide This is a daisy-chained network-connected I/O connection for the [[notes/Allen & Heath GLD-112|Allen & Heath GLD-112]]

item.title: Allen & Heath AR2412
item.description: User Manual This is the primary set of inputs for our board on the stage. Part of [[notes/Back of House Components|Back of House Components]].

item.title: Allen & Heath AR84
item.description: User Guide This is an expansion board for the [[notes/Allen & Heath GLD-112|Allen & Heath GLD-112]] which accepts 8 XLR inputs with remotely controlled gain and sends 4 XLR outputs.

item.title: Allen & Heath GLD-112
item.description: [[notes/manuals/GLD-User-Guide-AP8561_4.pdf|GLD-User-Guide-AP8561_4]] Main Mixing Console for the church. A full-featured digital mixing board. The board is incredibly flexible. It allows configuring up to 20 mix outputs.

item.title: Aviom A360
item.description: User Manual This is the mixing console used for each In-Ear Monitor. We have 7 or 8 of them.

item.title: Aviom AN-16/O
item.description: User Guide Used for Aviom IEMs. The DB25 to XLR snake cable from this to the [[notes/Shure PSM900 Transmitter P9T|Shure PSM900 Transmitter P9T]] for IEM headset 3 is faulty.

item.title: Aviom D800 Pro 16e
item.description: User Manual This is the Aviom box that communicates with the Aviom individual mixers. It also communicates over a direct “A-Net” Cat5e cable to the [[notes/Aviom AN-16 - O|Aviom AN-16 - O]]

item.title: Back of House Components
item.description: Audio Signal Path [[notes/Allen & Heath AR2412]] [[notes/Allen & Heath AB168]] Speaker System (unused) [[QSC RMX850]] (x2) [[QSC RMX1450]] (amp, labeled “front”) IEM Systems [[Aviom D800 Pro 16e]] Dante primary port attached, snakes up at house right corner, connects directly to [[notes/Allen & Heath GLD-112]] [[Aviom A360]] (x7?

item.title: Front of House Components
item.description: Main Signal Path [[notes/Sennheiser A1031U Antenna|Sennheiser A1031U Antenna]] (x2) [[notes/Sennheiser ASA1 Antenna Splitter|Sennheiser ASA1 Antenna Splitter]] [[Sennheiser EW 100 G3]] (x1) [[Sennheiser EW 300 G3]] (x7) [[notes/Allen & Heath AR84]] [[notes/Allen & Heath GLD-112]] [[Shure DFR22]] Mother’s Room System [[QSC Audio PLX1602]] [[Renkus-Heinz PNX61]] IEM System [[M-Dante Option Card]] [[Aviom AN-16 - O]] [[Furman CN-1800S]] Power [[Furman CN-1800S]] Unused Components [[Williams Sound PPA T45]] See Also [[notes/Back of House Components|Back of House Components]]

item.title: Furman CN-1800S
item.description: User Manual Power conditioner & sequencer. We have one of these at the front-of-house audio console, and one in the primary back-of-house rack.

item.title: Furman P-8 Pro Series II
item.description: User Manual This is a power conditioner, used to power all the [[Back of House Components]]. I/O Power input A/C plug plugged into circuit 3 on the wall.

item.title: M-Dante Option Card
item.description: User Manual This card adds 64 audio in and 64 audio outs for the [[notes/Allen & Heath GLD-112]]. In our system, the only usage of Dante is for the IEM system.

item.title: Netgear GS108T
item.description: Software User Manual Hardware Installation Guide This is a managed gigabit 5-port ethernet switch. It allows expanding the Dante network connection (previously only a point-to-point network connecting the [[notes/Allen & Heath GLD-112]] via its [[M-Dante Option Card]] to the [[Aviom D800 Pro 16e]]).

item.title: QSC Audio PLX1602
item.description: User Manual I/O Power in [[Furman CN-1800S]] (delay 2) XLR In [[notes/Allen & Heath AR84]] (output channel 1) Speaker Wire Out [[Renkus-Heinz PNX61]] (Mother’s room speaker)

item.title: QSC RMX1450
item.description: User Manual This is an amp in our [[Back of House Components]] setup, labeled “FRONT”. It’s unclear whether it’s used for anything, but it seems likely that the answer is no, since the channels feeding it have no output assigned from the board.

item.title: QSC RMX850
item.description: This is a power amplifier. We have two of them in [[Back of House Components]]. One is labeled “CHOIR” and the other is labeled “REMOTES.

item.title: Renkus-Heinz PNX61
item.description: User Manual This is the speaker in the mother’s room. I/O Speaker Wire in [[QSC Audio PLX1602]]

item.title: Sennheiser A1031U Antenna
item.description: This is the antenna that is used for receiving signals from the wireless handheld microphones and the wireless packs for headset microphones.

item.title: Sennheiser ASA1 Antenna Splitter
item.description: User Manual We have two of these. Each connects to 4 of the [[Sennheiser EW 300 G3]] (one of them is actually to 3 of those, and 1 [[Sennheiser EW 100 G3]]).

item.title: Sennheiser EW 100 G3
item.description: User Manual A headset pack receiver. Used for headset D. I/O 1/4" jack out [[notes/Allen & Heath AR84]] input 8 (XLR on that end) BNC In [[Sennheiser ASA1 Antenna Splitter]]

item.title: Sennheiser EW 300 G3
item.description: User Manual A wireless microphone receiver. Used to connect to both wireless headset and wireless handheld microphones. I/O 1/4" Jack Out [[notes/Allen & Heath AR84]] inputs 1–7 The other end of the cable has XLR.

item.title: Shure DFR22
item.description: User Manual Software User Guide This is a DSP platform ( website) that we use to run audio processing on the Mains signal.

item.title: Shure PA805SWB Antenna
item.description: User Manual Antenna to drive the IEM packs. I/O BNC in [[Shure PA821A Antenna Combiner]] RF Out Shure IEM packs

item.title: Shure PA821A Antenna Combiner
item.description: User Manual Combines RF signals from 6 Transmitters to a single antenna. NOTE: As of 2023-07-24, the cable from this antenna combiner to the antenna had an extension coax removed.

item.title: Shure PSM900 Transmitter P9T
item.description: User Manual These are wireless transmitters to drive audio on the In-Ear Monitor systems. I/O XLR In [[Aviom AN-16 - O]] (split out from the DB25 connectors) BNC Out [[Shure PA821A Antenna Combiner]]

item.title: Williams Sound PPA T45
item.description: User Manual A small radio transmitter for assistive hearing. We don’t use this at all, but it appears to be connected properly and we should be able to use it if we have need for it.
